name: Anthropic Agent Skills
description: A new open standard protocol released on December 24, 2025 for AI interoperability. Agent Skills provides a universal language for AI agents to communicate and collaborate across different platforms and tools.
community_quotes: The new universal language for AI interoperability
Open standard protocol for AI agent collaboration

name: MiniMax M2.1
description: Chinese AI startup MiniMax's latest model with significantly enhanced performance for real-world applications and multi-language programming versatility, positioning it as a competitive option for AI-powered coding tasks.
community_quotes: Significantly enhanced performance for real-world applications

name: GLM-4.7
description: Zhipu AI's latest flagship model specifically designed for 'Agentic Coding' scenarios, achieving 73.8% on SWE-bench benchmark with enhanced programming abilities, better long-term task planning, improved tool collaboration, and more stable multi-step reasoning.
community_quotes: Claims leading performance among open-source models on multiple public benchmarks
Compatible with 20+ popular AI coding tools including Claude Code

name: Zenflow
description: A free AI orchestration desktop platform that brings engineering discipline to AI coding. Analyzes developer tasks, plans work, assigns steps to specialized coding agents, and uses multi-agent verification with specification-driven workflows.
community_quotes: Ends the era of vibe coding and brings engineering discipline to AI
Turns unpredictable agent behavior into reliable, repeatable engineering velocity

name: GitHub Spark
description: An AI-powered prompt-based app builder that lets anyone build micro-apps without writing code. Users describe their idea in natural language and Spark transforms it into a working application.
community_quotes: Lets anyone build micro-apps without needing to write code
Transform natural language descriptions into functional applications
